en: The second one is is it functional?
Are we actually solving for purpose?
Is there something out there that an athlete
or somebody on the design floor, really wants that isn't there?
So then focusing on a function like the next one is beauty.
So as you know, everything we do is so simplistic.
What can we strip away?
Really looking at beauty as a 360 degree approach to it.
You come to this floor.
We're not looking at just drawing things.
We're actually creating things three dimensionally.
So looking at what can we strip down?
What can we minimize on this.
If you look at the original zipper garages and things like that.
It was just this beautiful way to how is a zipper to make it waterproof.
But just looking at how we can obsess over those little details.
So that's this concept of housing function and beauty.
And then the fourth one is, responsibility.
So there's a lot of talk around sustainability.
And we like to actually not use that word.
We like to use the word responsible.
So when we look at how we design product, looking at the durability of it,
the longevity of it,
we want people to actually have our product as long as possible.
So when we start to talking about the concept of sustainability,
what's the repairability of it?
You went to ARC’ONE and you got to see all this return product.
So this design team gets to go there and obsess and like dig through all that
and see where it failure points.
How can we then design into that.
So that doesn't happen again.
What's repairability.
So those four filters is number one.
Is it authentic.
Number two is functional is a beautiful.
And is it responsible.
If it's those things then we get to put a bird on it.
That's it.
So it doesn't get a bird unless it has those things.
And a lot of times we'll go into
sketch reviews which are sketching on paper.
It's truly prototyping and making.
And we'll look at something and as, as we feel like it's ready, we're like,
does it deserve a bird?
And we've actually said sometimes, no it doesn't.
Can I put somebody else's logo on that? Maybe.
Then let's not make it.
Let's go back to the drawing board.
Let's reassess it and figure it out.
So that's kind of the philosophy and the filters that we go through.
